reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked "budget" hotels on 3 islands through Sharksky and this was the nicest of the three. The room was comfortable and pretty quiet despite having only screens (no glass) on the windows in the front of the unit. There was a concert of some sort on the edge of town we could hear pretty clearly on the Saturday night we were there, but it ended by 10pm. It had a little kitchen area which we didn't have a chance to use other than the fridge, and the pool was a nice change of pace from the chilly ocean.
reviews.title: Nicest place we stayed in the Galapagos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be forewarned that if the power goes out on the island (which happened early in the morning of our stay), the water also goes off (but this seemed to be true everywhere else in town too). Breakfast (eggs, toast, juice, tea) was served without a hitch, though.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and absolutely loved every second of it.
reviews.title: Staying in San Cristobal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was massive and clean, the showers had a really cool design, the beds were comfortable, there was airconditioning, a safe, and a little kitchen.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Cristobal

reviews.text: We also had a pool just outside our bedroom door, and they offer free bicycles for their guests (save you from renting them in town for $4 per hour.
reviews.title: A good hosteria on San Cristobal
